ResourceHeader.ResourceName: TWINS 1 Neutral-atom L1 Images and Movies

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, metadata versioned up to SPASE 2.6.0, reviewed by LFB 20230727

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: TWINS 1 neutral-atom spectrometer level-1 magnetospheric images and image movies at full (9 energy steps and 15 minute) resolution. Images have been smoothed using a technique that provides approximately uniform statistics across the image. Each image has 4x4 degree angular resolution and includes 15 minutes of data. These images are derived on the ground from direct events measurements of the time of flight and detection location on the anode for individual ENAs. Each image has 4x4 degree angular resolution and includes 15 minutes of data. The first dimension of the image represents the scan angle in instrument coordinates. In this system the azimuthal attitude vector points to +90 degree scan angle. The second is the imaged angle, where 90 degrees is the central viewing angle of the instrument and the direction of the polar attitude vector.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the CDAWeb team at GSFC/SPDF.

Parameter.Name: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Epoch

Parameter.Name: satellite
Parameter.Description: Satellite ID number (1=twins1 or 2=twins2)

Parameter.Name: smooth_image
Parameter.Description: TWINS smooth image of neutral atom flux for all energies

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 1 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 1 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 4 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 4 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 8 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 8 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 12 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 12 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 16 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 16 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 20 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 20 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 25 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 25 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 30 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 30 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth image @ 50 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: Statistically smoothed TWINS image of flux per energy at 50 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: pixel_sweep_count
Parameter.Description: The per-pixel sweep count is the number of times a given pixel was sampled by the instrument during the time taken to make the image. This value is only a function of longitude (actuation angle), and so is the same for all latitude (imaged) pixels at a given scan (actuation) angle. The value is nominally the same for all pixels in an image, and is the same as the number of sweeps in the image. Differences from this value are due to errors in either actuator motion or transmission of data from agiven direction.

Parameter.Name: target value
Parameter.Description: Target value for the number of counts per pixel used in the smoothing algorithm. This value can vary by energy.

Parameter.Name: energy
Parameter.Description: Array of energy values (in keV) for the smoothed images. Nominally 1, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 25, 30, and 50 keV.

Parameter.Name: smoothing algorithm version
Parameter.Description: [LIST ONLY] version of the smoothing algorithm used to create the TWINS_SMOOTH_IMAGE.

Parameter.Name: units
Parameter.Description: [LIST ONLY] units of smoothed twins image

Parameter.Name: lon min
Parameter.Description: Longitude (deg) at the middle of the first pixel. For 4 deg pixel_size this is nominally -88 degrees.

Parameter.Name: lon max
Parameter.Description: Longitude (deg) at the middle of the last pixel. For 4 deg pixel_size this is nominally -92 degrees.

Parameter.Name: lat min
Parameter.Description: Latitude (deg) at the middle of the first pixel. For 4 deg pixel_size this is nominally 4 degrees.

Parameter.Name: lat max
Parameter.Description: Latitude (deg) at the middle of the last pixel. For 4 deg pixel_size this is nominally 88 degrees.

Parameter.Name: lat pixel bin size
Parameter.Description: The pixel size in the imaging (polar) direction.

Parameter.Name: lon pixel bin size
Parameter.Description: The pixel size in the scan (longitudinal) direction.

Parameter.Name: start/stop time of image
Parameter.Description: Start time of the image and the stop time of the image

Parameter.Name: start/stop time of image (MJD)
Parameter.Description: Start time of the image and the stop time of the image in Modified Julian Date (MJD)

Parameter.Name: smooth_error_image
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image for all energies. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS smooth Error_Image @ 1 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 1 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 4 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 4 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 8 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 8 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 12 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 12 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 16 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 16 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 20 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 20 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 25 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 25 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 30 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 30 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Smooth Error_Image @ 50 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS smoothed image error image at 50 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is given by sqrt(counts) / counts using the counts included in each pixel of the image.

Parameter.Name: Attitude/Ephemeris flag
Parameter.Description: A flag that identifies when attitude and ephemeris information are available. A value of 0 indicates data are available; a value of 1 indicates that either attitude or ephemeris information is not available for a given time interval.

Parameter.Name: attitude_delta_deg
Parameter.Description: The change (in degrees) of the spacecraft attitude vector over the time required to make the given image.

Parameter.Name: spacecraft position
Parameter.Description: The average spacecraft location vector over the time interval of the image in ECI coordinates (cartesian XYZ components).

Parameter.Name: polar attitude
Parameter.Description: The average polar pointing unit vector over the time interval of the image in ECI coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components). The polar attitude vector points to 90 degree instrument polar (imaged) angle.

Parameter.Name: azimuth attitude
Parameter.Description: The average azimuthal pointing unit vector over the time interval of the image in ECI coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components). The azimuthal pointing vector points to +90 degree instrument scan angle.

Parameter.Name: sun position
Parameter.Description: The average Sun unit vector over the time interval of the image in ECI coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components).

Parameter.Name: magnetic dipole
Parameter.Description: The average geomagnetic dipole unit vector over the time interval of the image in ECI coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components).

Parameter.Name: spacecraft position
Parameter.Description: The average spacecraft location vector over the time interval of the image in SM coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components).

Parameter.Name: polar attitude
Parameter.Description: The average polar pointing unit vector over the time interval of the image in SM coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components). The polar attitude vector points to 90 degree instrument polar (imaged) angle.

Parameter.Name: azimuth attitude
Parameter.Description: The average azimuthal pointing unit vector over the time interval of the image in SM coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components). The azimuthal pointing vector points to +90 degree instrument scan angle.

Parameter.Name: sun position
Parameter.Description: The average Sun position unit vector over the time interval of the image in SM coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components).

Parameter.Name: magnetic dipole
Parameter.Description: The average geomagnetic dipole unit vector over the time interval of the image in SM coordinates (Cartesian XYZ components).

Parameter.Name: sat location
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft radial distance (in Earth radii) from the center of the Earth.

Parameter.Name: lat
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft latitude in SM coordinates

Parameter.Name: lshell
Parameter.Description: The McIlwain L-Shell at the spacecraft location assuming a dipole magnetic field model and using SM coordinates.

Parameter.Name: mlt
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft magnetic local time in SM coordinates.

Parameter.Name: energy
Parameter.Description: Array of energy values (in keV) for the images. Nominally 1, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 25, 30, and 50 keV.

Parameter.Name: image type
Parameter.Description: 0 for a Differential Energy Flux image. 1 for an All Energies image

Parameter.Name: saveset_version
Parameter.Description: saveset_version

Parameter.Name: times/sweeps
Parameter.Description: [LIST ONLY] Start and stop times of the image, along with the selected number of sweeps.

Parameter.Name: units
Parameter.Description: [LIST ONLY] units of raw twins image

Parameter.Name: software version
Parameter.Description: [LIST ONLY] Software version

Parameter.Name: image creation time
Parameter.Description: [LIST ONLY] Time image was created

Parameter.Name: twins_raw_image
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image of flux for all energies

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 1 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 1 keV energy, in units of (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 4 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 4 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 8 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 8 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 12 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 16 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 16 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 20 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 20 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 25 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 25 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 30 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 30 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Name: TWINS Raw Image @ 50 keV (cm^2 sr s eV)^-1
Parameter.Description: TWINS raw image at 50 keV energy, in the same format as the 1 keV image.

Parameter.Name: raw_error_image
Parameter.Description: TWINS error image for raw image at all energies. The error in the flux for each pixel is based on the error in the fit of flux vs energy used to determine the flux value given in the primary image.

Parameter.Name: Raw Error Image @ 1 keV
Parameter.Description: TWINS error image for raw image at 1 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is based on the error in the fit of flux vs energy used to determine the flux value given in the primary image.

Parameter.Description: TWINS error image for raw image at 4 keV energy. The error in the flux for each pixel is based on the error in the fit of flux vs energy used to determine the flux value given in the primary image.
